title: Who was Johnny Allen in EastEnders and when did he kill Dennis Rickman?
text:
Johnny Allen was only in EastEnders for a year but caused a whole lot of trouble (Picture: BBC)

A name from the past comes back to haunt Sharon Mitchell (Letitia Dean) in EastEnders tonight as she negotiates the sale of E20 with Ruby Allen (Louisa Lytton).

Because, as the conversation becomes heated, Sharon gives mention to Ruby’s dad Johnny Allen – the man responsible for the death of her husband Dennis Rickman (Nigel Harman).

Naturally it unsettles her, as she points out she doesn’t really want to be negotiating with Johnny’s daughter – but just who was he, and when did Dennis fall victim to him?

Here’s what you need to know…

Who was Johnny Allen in EastEnders?

Johnny joined the show all the way back in 2005 with his then teenage daughter Ruby.

He was a gangster at the centre of some pretty dramatic storylines, initially moving in as the new owner of Albert Square’s then nightclub Scarlet (formerly known as Angie’s Den) – and going on to be responsible for the deaths of both Dennis and crime boss Andy Hunter (Michael Higgs).

The role was played by actor Billy Murray (Picture: BBC)

He had several run-ins with the Mitchell brothers too, which led to them almost being killed by Johnny’s sidekick Danny Moon (Jake Maskall).

Things eventually came to a head for Johnny after Ruby discovered the true extent of his crimes and urged him to turn himself into police – following the show’s Get Johnny Week which resulted in the death of Danny Moon.

The character later died of a heart attack in prison.

Although his time in the show was brief – with Johnny being killed off in 2006 – his impact was a big one, with the character also winning best villain at that year’s British Soap Awards.

When did Johnny Allen kill Sharon’s husband Dennis Rickman?

Although it was actually Danny Moon who delivered the fatal stab wound to Dennis, it was Johnny who ordered his death.

The tragedy occurred after Sharon found out she was pregnant with baby Denny, and the couple had been due to leave the Square on New Year’s Eve to begin anew in the US.

Dennis had been involved in a feud with Johnny at t he time and the gangster had told Sharon – upon learning she was pregnant – that he would not kill Dennis if they had left Walford by midnight on New Year’s Eve.

Dennis and Sharon were set to leave together before tragedy struck (Picture: BBC)

However things went badly wrong after Sharon confided this in Phil, who promptly told Dennis – who responded by giving Johnny a severe beating and leaving him close to death.

After tossing him a mobile phone and telling him that if he could reach it he would live, Johnny called a henchman to murder Dennis as revenge – leading to him being fatally stabbed in the Square before the couple could leave.

Danny Moon was later revealed to have been Dennis’ killer.

Who played Johnny Allen in EastEnders?

The role was played by actor Billy Murray.

The actor has appeared in a string of British flicks including Rollin’ With The Nines, Rise of The Footsoldier, Dead Cert and Doghouse – and he’s also the voice of Captain John Price in the Call Of Duty games series.

EastEnders airs on BBC One on Mondays and Fridays at 8pm and on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7.30pm.
